review_title: Very good but not without flaws
one_reviews_text:
Positives:
+ Nice, simple, and elegant interface.
+ Has a decent, basic set of controls for 3D video adjustment.
+ Support for many audio formats. Works: AC3, TrueHD, AAC, DTS, and DTS-HD MA has worked for me. Worksn't: Atmos (plays the TrueHD part).
+ A few nice visual environments to choose from (if that's your thing) and settings to adjust ambient light level (could be nice with finer increments, though).

Negatives (+bugs):
- VobSub subtitles don't work
- Audio track sync not fine enough. Should have +/- 10ms buttons as well.
- Displays (some?) internal subs double on the screen.
- No 3D (binaural) mapping of the multi-channel audio tracks. It's seems quite the contradiction to watch video in beautiful 3D while hearing 1-dimensional audio inside your head. And no, Windows Sonic for Headphones is not an option - it pretty much sucks (badly) in that regard. I think Oculus provides the libraries needed (as well as SteamVR) so it shouldn't be that hard to implement. (Someone even made a free 3D audio plug-in for positional audio in SkyrimVR, which works perfectly - in Skyrim...) Imagine having real 3D surround sound with just headphones while watching 3D movies...
- Forgets at every restart that I've turned off the ambient lighting. The slider is showing the correct value in the settings, but is still showing some ambient light. Adjusting it up and down fixes it, but it's annoying to have to do this for every restart.

Things I haven't tried (yet):
* 3D BluRays (ISO).
* Some audio formats: DTS:X (I'd expect it to play the DTS-HD MA part).

Tried a lot and this one has such an intuitive interface to it... It's not an overhaul media player though.  I like being able to navigate the videos as is, but would greatly enjoy being able to navigate through stereoscopic still images too.

Beforehand, I basically tested with 3D movies and clips.

In this regard the projected and wanted playstyle did not settle in most cases. Like, I always want cinema mode, which is not selectable as default. So you have to set it with every new movie. Cinema Mode itself has a to small screen, which takes away much of the 3D effects of the shown movie. I would like to have it resizable like DeoVR has it. Also it is very bad in detecting the mode of the movie (side by side or upper and lower panel)
Short: It needs settings which allows you to choose your personal view likings and a little improvement with movie state detection.
Besides this, it is a very nice and clean player.

review_title: The ONLY VR video player you will need
one_reviews_text:
I bought almost all the existing VR video players all the way back since the beginning of VR. (not 1980's :-) ) This one is so far my go to player since I tried it. Although it's still Alpha version, but the elegancy of UI & UX, stability, performance, (especially subtitle) are far better than ANY other VR players you can get. I reported some minor issues yesterday (Saturday), the developers actually released TWO updates within 12 hours (Sunday)! Salute! Comparing to some dev who has disappeared years ago since we all paid for his BETA (cough MaxVR cough).
According to their website, Skybox also supports DNLA and UPNP and all the NAS and Plex, on the other hand, it's such pain for the other VR players to even watch videos on my network drives.
One tip for the users: try Oculus Remote (the one you got for free but never used for once), it's such a perfect partner for the smoothest viewing experience!
Would be great if you can implement in a future release watching online streams (for example youtube)
review_feedback: Hey guess what, we are adding URL streaming support very soon now! Thought you might wanna know :)
